1.text: My spirit being destroyed my days were extinct; the graves are for me.

2.text: If not mockings with me? and shall not mine eye lodge in their bitterness?

3.text: Set up now, pledge me with thee: who is he will strike for my hand?

4.text: For thou didst hide their heart from understanding; for this thou wilt not exalt them.

5.text: He will commence evils for a position, and the eyes of his sons shall be consumed.

6.text: He set me for a parable of the peoples, and I shall be one spit upon to the face.

7.text: And mine eye shall be weak from vexation, and my thoughts as a shadow all of them.

8.text: The upright shall be astonished upon this, and the innocent Shall arouse himself against the profane.

9.text: And the just shall hold on his way, and the clean one of hands shall add strength.

10.text: But ye all shall turn back, and come ye now, and I shall not find a wise one among you.

11.text: My days passed away, my purposes were broken; the possessions of my heart.

12.text: They will set the night for day: the light being near from the face of darkness.

13.text: If I shall wait, hades is my house: in darkness I spread my bed.

14.text: I called to the pit: Grave, thou my father: and to the worm, My mother, and my sister.

15.text: And where now my hope? and my hope who shall regard it?

16.text: They shall go down to the bars of hades if together we shall go down to the dust.
